results.title: We discovered North Norway
results.brief_description: A train trip in the land of the midnight sun, through more than 500 tunnels. Per Host shows the grandeur of Northern Norway, which until recently very few Norwegians had ever seen. It is a geographical anomaly that here, north of the arctic circle, one can sun-bathe and swim in the fjords amid the towering peaks and plunging ravines.

results.title: The Land my mother = Walya ngamardiki
results.creator_credit: India Bharti, David Roberts, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Inspired by Silas Roberts, a tribal elder of the Allawa clan who wrote to the 1976 Australian Government inquiry on uranium mining, this film gives an insight into the Aborigines’ attitude towards uranium mining. They tell of the myths and legends associated with the land and their sacred places, and why they object to the mining being carried out. Commentary by Bob Maza.
results.creator_credit_for_label: India Bharti, David Roberts, Tom Manefield and Film Australia

results.title: Transport today
results.creator_credit: David Corke, Ken J. Widdowson and Education Media Australia
results.brief_description: This film provides a brief survey of modern transport. The film has been produced without commentary, only natural effects, and has been designed as an introduction to the study of transport. The film does not deal with any one aspect in detail but shows a range of examples which makes a good starting point for inquiry.

results.title: 'Where dead men lie': spotlight the director
results.creator_credit: Graham Chase, Chris McGill, Richard Mason and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Based on the production of “Where dead men lie”, highlighting the role of the director, Keith Gow. This film shows his involvement in screen testing, location shooting, editing and mixing. Suitable for Years 7-12.

results.title: Olives don't float
results.creator_credit: Peter McKinley, Edwin Moses, Don Anderson and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Peter Cummins plays an experienced seafarer who surveys the people and boats in the bay and points out the good and bad safety features of the various craft, their pilots and passengers. Production Manager: Penny Chapman. Cast includes: Frank Banset, Ray Sangston, Nino Ceron, Peter Eldridge, Jan Kuplis, Christine Ellison, Peter McKinley, Sven Kuplis, Julian Harvey, Peter Lewis.

results.title: Ned Kelly: paintings by Sidney Nolan
results.creator_credit: Alan Harkness, Tim Burstall, Patrick Ryan and Eltham Films
results.brief_description: The story of Australia’s best known bushranger is told through the paintings of Sidney Nolan, accompanied by a ballad played on the guitar. Made with the co-operation of the Museum of Modern Art of Australia.

results.title: Industrial Britain
results.creator_credit: John Grierson, Edgar H. Anstey, Robert Joseph Flaherty and Empire Marketing Board
results.brief_description: In 1931, with Nanook, Moana and Tabu behind him, Flaherty came to London to collaborate with John Grierson’s new government-supported documentary unit at the Empire Marketing Board. By 1932, Grierson had recruited a number of young men to the unit who he coached on film projects. This documentary resulted from the collaborative efforts and contributions of such a team. The film celebrates the craftmanship of British workers and as it captures the skills of potters, machinists, glassblowers and other tradesmen engaged in their work. Photographed by Robert Flaherty with additional photgraphy by Basil Wright, Arthur Elton and John Grierson. Edited by Edgar Anstey and John Grierson. Narrated by Donald Calthrop.
